title: Tailwind CSS Customization & Advanced
description: Flashcards on customizing Tailwind, using plugins, and leveraging advanced features.

cards.q: How do you extend the default theme in Tailwind?
cards.a: By editing the theme section in tailwind.config.js to add custom colors, fonts, spacing, etc.
Extend the colors object in tailwind.config.js with your custom palette.
Plugins are packages that extend Tailwind's functionality, adding new utilities or components.

cards.q: How to install a Tailwind plugin?
cards.a: Use npm or yarn to install the plugin, then include it in the plugins array in tailwind.config.js.

cards.q: What is the purpose of @apply directive?
cards.a: It allows applying multiple utility classes to create custom component styles in CSS.

cards.q: Can you create your own utility classes?
cards.a: Yes, using @layer or @variants in your CSS files, combined with @apply.
Tailwind automatically generates variants, but you can configure custom variants in tailwind.config.js.

cards.q: What is dark mode in Tailwind?
cards.a: A feature that applies different styles based on user's dark/light preference, toggled via class or media query.

cards.q: How do you enable dark mode?
cards.a: By setting dark mode to 'media' or 'class' in tailwind.config.js.
Variants are different states like hover, focus, active, responsive, and dark, which modify utility classes.

cards.q: How can you generate custom variants?
cards.a: Configure the variants array in tailwind.config.js for specific plugins or utilities.
Just-In-Time mode generates styles on-demand during development, leading to smaller CSS files.

cards.q: How do you optimize production builds?
cards.a: Use PurgeCSS default in Tailwind to remove unused styles, or configure 'purge' options.
Using square brackets, e.g., hover:[&:not(:last-child)], for fine-tuned styling.

cards.q: Can Tailwind be integrated with frameworks?
cards.a: Yes, it works seamlessly with React, Vue, Angular, Svelte, etc.

cards.q: How do you create custom components?
cards.a: Using @apply, @layer, or component libraries built with Tailwind like Tailwind UI.

cards.q: How do you handle responsive typography?
cards.a: Use responsive variants of font size classes, e.g., text-lg md:text-xl.
Use @font-face or link fonts in HTML, then use font-family extensions in Tailwind.

cards.q: What is the best way to customize Tailwind for a project?
cards.a: Extend the theme in tailwind.config.js, use plugins, and purge unused styles for optimization.
